comment:
Professor Vincenzo is great!
He is a little demanding at times with what you should know, but the class is not hard at all.
He is very helpful if you ask questions and is understanding and caring. 
There is a lot of homework but it is also not hard at all.
Just participate and get your stuff done and you should be fine.
Overall, he is great!

Good professor! Off the bat he WILL call your name in class which at first was embarrassing but when you realize none of the students know what they're doing it's comforting. There's group projects, and only 3 tests a semester, but weekly assignments. He likes seeing students show they care to learn Italian and putting in effort. Fun class & ATTEND

I loved this teacher, but if you arent used to Italian mannerisms or culture you might have some difficulties in the beginning. If you pay attention in class and do the homework you can easily get an A. he inst not very good at getting you the rubric for assignments early, so just try not to fall behind. if you show effort he will reward you.

This is the worst, most condescending teacher I have ever had. He has zero lessons planned; he will tell you that "you are not trying hard enough" and will jump all around while teaching because he has no idea what direction he wants to go in. Absolutely no one has any idea what is going on in the class and we are all struggling
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Really good professor. His heavy accent at the beginning could be hard on you but after few lessons you get used to it. He doesn't like when you don't try to learn and I can understand that. The professor tries to get out the best from the students and if you follow him you can get an A without a problem.

I've taken this guy for Italian 1001, 1002, as well as 2001 and I can safely say this guy is the coolest guy you will ever meet. I got A's in both 1001 and 1002 even though he is not the easiest. He truly makes learning a language fun and some of his stories will make you chuckle... please take this guy if you have the chance. He's a legend.

Love him!! Super helpful. Study & you'll get an A. If you are easily embarrassed, let him know and he won't call on you. Really enjoyed taking his class. I didn't have to study too hard and still got an A, very possible. Take him! :)
Love Vincenzo, he is toe best and makes learning Italian super interesting and enjoyable.

He is a great professor. He has a thick Italian accent but is very passionate about the language. He gives you study guides before the tests and is always open for questions. Overall, good professor; I really enjoyed the class.

I've taken him before, and didn't really like him. But I grew to like him more. He's very relaxed and I love the way he always talks about his home in Italy and Italian culture all the time. I got an A both times I've taken him, so I would recommend him.
Excellent professor!  His love of the Italian culture and language is quite evident in his style of teaching.  Would definitely take another class with him.

He's a nice enough guy, but if you have any other options, don't take him. He gave us work that was way above our level and didn't learn anyone's name. There was only 9 in the class. He thinks the only way for people to learn was to embarrass them by making them read aloud. He didn't try to be mean, but he was. It's still possible to get A though.
